page.title: 04 Hardingstone Primary School
page.content: The school was built in 1966 and is not very big. It has 128 children in five classes. They start school at 4+ and leave,usually to go to Roade School, at 11. The school building, which is mainly flat roofed, is in good condition and the staff think that it does not need much improvement. The design is quite different from Wootton school as at Hardingstone most of the classrooms are joined on to the hall. The school has a pleasant friendly atmosphere and the work done is very similar to that at Wootton except that they do more projects. The children's favourite lessons are mathematics, English and art.Some of the teachers think that computers will not become important unless there are more of them available in schools.
